DataElement.preferredDefinition: Response indicating the type of post-treatment assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Evaluation of a change in the condition under investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004_A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions._Having determined the value, significance, or extent of._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One and the other; relating to or being two in conjunction.: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products. : Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Concepts.definition: One and the other; relating to or being two in conjunction.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A substance sometimes found in an increased amount in the blood, other body fluids, or tissues and which may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body. Examples of tumor markers include CA 125 (ovarian cancer), CA 15-3 (breast cancer), CEA (ovarian, lung, breast, pancreas, and gastrointestinal tract cancers), and PSA (prostate cancer). Also called biomarker.

Concepts.definition: A substance present in or produced by a tumor or by the host, that can be used for differentiating neoplastic from normal tissue based on measurements in body fluids, secretions, cells, and/or tissues. Markers are used in diagnosis, staging and prognosis of cancer, provide an estimation of tumor burden, and serve for monitoring effects of therapy, detecting recurrence, localization of tumors, and screening in general populations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An image produced on a radiosensitive surface by x-ray radiation that has penetrated and passed through a structure.

Concepts.definition: An image produced on a radiosensitive surface by x-ray radiation that has penetrated and passed through a structure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match current NCIt. mc 4.23.19

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the nucleus.: The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the nucleus.
The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.
Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.: (noor-uh-LOJ-ik) Having to do with nerves or the nervous system.: Cancer that continues to grow or spread.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One and the other; relating to or being two in conjunction.: The use of radiation (such as x-rays) or other imaging technologies (such as ultrasound and magnetic resonance imaging) to diagnose or treat disease.: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.: (noor-uh-LOJ-ik) Having to do with nerves or the nervous system.

Concepts.definition: One and the other; relating to or being two in conjunction.
The branch of medical science dealing with the medical use of X-rays or other penetrating radiation.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test.

Concepts.definition: The outcome of a laboratory test.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
